channel.title: Compiler help?
channel.description:
Okay when I try to use the compiler I get this message:
This device is not ready. Click any key to continue . . .
I get this message in a 'round the bout way on every source I try to compile. Im using Sk1ttlezrule43v source.
If I go to the compiler and edit it in notepad this is what it says:
@echo off COLOR 05 title Sk1ttlezrule43v Compiler "D:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_12\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
Can someone fix this for me somehow to work and actually compile? I have no idea at all. I have JDK 6 Update 12.

item.title: Compiler help?
item.dc:creator: @Sokid Sokid
item.description:
@Sokid wrote:

Ooh gosh find where my Java is located. When I find it can I just drag and drop it into my C:?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 24, 2009, 09:00:11 pm[/size][hr]Actually I just found my Java folder under
Computer > C: > Program Files > Java
In the Java folder there are three other folders:

jre1.6.0
jre.1.6.0_02
jre6

Anyone else think they can help?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 24, 2009, 09:04:55 pm[/size][hr]I’m still getting

The system cannot find the path specified.
Press any key to continue . . .

And the code now is:

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Go up and look at my other posts above to see the previous codes and my Java version and etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Mmk, shouldn’t be too hard.
Just find where your Java is located, then copy and paste the place where it’s located.

Read full topic

item.description:

Java Version: 1.6.0_12 from Sun Microsystems Inc.

Okay, that means you don’t have update 11.
http://www.javatester.org/version.html
Tell me what you get.

item.title: Compiler help?
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

D:?

shouldnt that be C:\

also change jdk1.7.0_12 to jdk1.6.0_12

right now it is set to run on jdk 7 update 12, not JDK 6.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

1.7.0_12 <<< The newest version is 1.6.0_12…
And are you sure your Java files are in your D: drive instead of C:?

Read full topic
